publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1316 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Scottish Centre for Learning Disability—That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of a Scottish Centre for Learning Disability; notes the Scottish Executive’s commitment to the dispersal of government institutions and services throughout Scotland, and urges it to support the siting of the Centre in Inverness. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-1316 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Scottish Centre for Learning Disability—That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of a Scottish Centre for Learning Disability; notes the Scottish Executive’s commitment to the dispersal of government institutions and services throughout Scotland, and urges it to support the siting of the Centre in Inverness. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Tommy Sheridan*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1316 Scottish Centre for Learning Disability (lodged on 2 November 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Nora Radcliffe*, Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Irene McGugan*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1316 Scottish Centre for Learning Disability (lodged on 2 November 2000) Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1316 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Scottish Centre for Learning Disability-That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of a Scottish Centre for Learning Disability; notes the Scottish Executive's commitment to the dispersal of government institutions and services throughout Scotland, and urges it to support the siting of the Centre in Inverness. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Nora Radcliffe, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Tricia Marwick, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1316 Scottish Centre for Learning Disability (lodged on 2 November 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-1316 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Scottish Centre for Learning Disability-That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of a Scottish Centre for Learning Disability; notes the Scottish Executive's commitment to the dispersal of government institutions and services throughout Scotland, and urges it to support the siting of the Centre in Inverness. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Nora Radcliffe, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Tricia Marwick, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Mary Scanlon, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill
